intro: Pectinaria asperiflora, commonly known as the rough-flowered pectinaria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to brown flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
